main event: An oval-shaped object was sighted near Huntsville, Texas on December 10, 1962.
interesting points: The object was reported to be the size of the head of a pin and as bright as a second magnitude star, The sighting was conducted via ground radar, and the object was believed to be too fast to be an aircraft and slower than a shooting star, There was speculation that the object could have been Sputnik III due to the timing of its appearance, The observation lasted for approximately 2 minutes, The Project Officer concluded there was insufficient data for definitive evaluation, considering various possibilities for the object's nature.
location: 10 MI W of Huntsville, Texas, USA
